alert.note: Alert for Henry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 26 at 2:21PM CDT until May 26 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in Quad Cities has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Henry IL County in northwestern Illinois... * Until 830 PM CDT Thursday. * At 221 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 6 and 30. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 10 and 33. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
